required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Research Study for Major Depressive Disorder: Investigation of Glutamate Medications
clinical_study.official_title: Continuation Riluzole in the Prevention of Relapse Following Ketamine in Major Depression

collaborator.agency: National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression

brief_summary.textblock: This study is examining the safety and effectiveness of two medications, ketamine and riluzole, in treating patients with treatment resistant major depressive disorder. This study will also examine the effectiveness of an FDA approved drug called lamotrigine in decreasing the potential side effects associated with ketamine.

detailed_description.textblock: This research proposal will investigate a glutamate-modulating agent, riluzole, in treatment-resistant patients who exhibit an acute, sustained response to a single dose of intravenous (IV) racemic ketamine. Fifty ketamine-responders will be randomized to riluzole or placebo in a 4-week, randomized, double-blind, continuation-phase study.

primary_outcome.measure: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MARDS) Score (Acute Response to IV Ketamine in Patients With Treatment Resistant Major Depression)
primary_outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale, each of the ten items can be scored from 0 (absence of symptoms to 6 most severe) and has a total score range of 0-60. A lower score on a MADRS indicates a less severe depression. The primary outcome for the initial phase of the trial was the 24-h MADRS score, which included all 10 MADRS items.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Lamotrigine in Decreasing IV Ketamine Psychotomimetic Side Effects
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate and side effect differences to IV ketamine infusion based on lamotrigine and placebo pretreatment groups

arm_group.description: Patients who met enrolment criteria for phase 1 were randomly allocated to lamotrigine or placebo by a permuted block procedure consisting of blocks of two or four patients. The randomization list was created by a biostatistician with no patient contact. 300 mg of lamotrigine 2 hrs prior to ketamine infusion. Responders were randomized to one of two continuation pharmacotherapy groups, receiving either two capsules of riluzole 50 mg each (100 mg/d) or matching pill placebo under double-blind conditions.

2 hours prior to ketamine infusion each patient received three capsules of placebo identical in size, weight, appearance, and taste to the lamotrigine tablets. Responders were randomized to one of two continuation pharmacotherapy groups, receiving either two capsules of riluzole 50 mg each (100 mg/d) or matching pill placebo under double-blind conditions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female patients, 21- 70 years of age
2. Subjects have a history of at least one previous episode of depression prior to the current episode (recurrent major depressive disorder) or have chronic major depressive disorder (at least two years' duration)
3. Subjects have not responded to an adequate trial of one antidepressant in the current episode
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Female subjects who are either pregnant or nursing
2. Serious, unstable illnesses
3. Any previous use or treatment with ketamine, or riluzole
4. Past intolerance to lamotrigine, including drug rash

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The intent-to-treat sample (n=26) was recruited from media/internet advertising (14), psychiatrist referral (8), or self-referral from the New York Mood Disorders Support Group (4). Patients had marked depressive severity, chronicity, and anxiety comorbidity, and were highly pharmacotherapy-resistant.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 2-wk psychotropic medication washout period (4 wk for fluoxetine)

group.title: Lamotrigine Pre-Treatment (Phase I)/Riluzole (Phase II)
group.description: Patients who met enrolment criteria for phase 1 were randomly allocated to lamotrigine or placebo by a permuted block procedure consisting of blocks of two or four patients. The randomization list was created by a biostatistician with no patient contact. Following baseline ratings, 2 h prior to i.v. ketamine infusion, patients received 300 mg lamotrigine or placebo by mouth. All non responders were exited from the study. All responders (in both the lamotrigine and placebo pre-treatment groups were treated as one group and randomized into either treatment with riluzole or placebo for Phase II)

group.title: Placebo Pre-Treatment (Phase I)/Placebo (Phase II)
group.description: Patients who met enrolment criteria for phase 1 were randomly allocated to lamotrigine or placebo by a permuted block procedure consisting of blocks of two or four patients. The randomization list was created by a biostatistician with no patient contact. Following baseline ratings, 2 h prior to i.v. ketamine infusion, patients received 300 mg lamotrigine or placebo by mouth. All non responders were exited from the study. All responders (in both the lamotrigine and placebo pre-treatment groups were treated as one group and randomized into either treatment with riluzole or placebo for Phase II)

participants_list.participants: 14 completers of phase I didn’t split up evenly (same way as phase I) in the riluzole/placebo phase.
14 completers of phase I didn’t split up evenly (same way as phase I) in the riluzole/placebo phase.

group.title: Lamotrigine Pre-Treatment

The randomization list was created by a biostatistician with no patient contact. Following baseline ratings, 2 h prior to i.v. ketamine infusion, patients received 300 mg lamotrigine or placebo by mouth.

group.title: Placebo Pre-Treatment
group.description: Patients who met enrolment criteria for phase 1 were randomly allocated to lamotrigine or placebo by a permuted block procedure consisting of blocks of two or four patients. The randomization list was created by a biostatistician with no patient contact. outcome.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MARDS) Score (Acute Response to IV Ketamine in Patients With Treatment Resistant Major Depression)
outcome.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale, each of the ten items can be scored from 0 (absence of symptoms to 6 most severe) and has a total score range of 0-60. A lower score on a MADRS indicates a less severe depression. The primary outcome for the initial phase of the trial was the 24-h MADRS score, which included all 10 MADRS items.

group.title: Riluzole Group
group.description: Patients who responded (n=14) to the ketamine infusion (in either the lamotrigine or placebo pre-treatment groups) were randomized into phase II for treatment with either riluzole or placebo. One patient in the riluzole group was discontinued/withdrew consent before completing the study.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients who responded (n=14) to the ketamine infusion (in either the lamotrigine or placebo pre-treatment groups) were randomized into phase II for treatment with either riluzole or placebo.

outcome.description: Response rate and side effect differences to IV ketamine infusion based on lamotrigine and placebo pretreatment groups

group.title: Ketamine
group.description: IV infusion of 0.5 mg/kg of Ketamine Hydrochloride

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The open-label administration of ketamine limits interpretation of phase 1 results. The sample size was too small to detect moderators and mediators of response. Third,lack of placebo-controlled efficacy data supporting riluzole's use in depression.
